About

I'm Solomon and I code.

While studying neuroscience, I supported my degree by teaching young children how to code with OpenWorld Learning (OWL) . OWL brought applied math, programming, and independence to disadvantaged children in Denver, Colorado. And for everyone in the program, the experience was life-changing.

As my students matured and overcame challenges, they inspired me. To advance in the program, each child had to integrate their creativity, logic, and emotional well-being. In the four years I spent with OWL, I bore witness to the joy that programming could bring.

Naturally, I began to wonder what opportunities awaited me if I switched from academia. Of course, there was only one way to find out. Shortly before OWL ceased operations, I took a chance on myself and tried a different path.

This decision led to a 2 year journey of self, group, and mentored study; a few portfolio projects; and a new perspective. Today, I write clean code, have the mindset to identify and solve problems, and continue to learn more about others and their needs.

When it's time to step away from the computer, you can find me staying active, singing choir, recording voiceover tracks, illustrating, and writing.
